item.name: Alchemists
item.comment: You are competing to be the most prestigious Alchemiet, by publishing your theories, debunking others theories and generally showing off. A worker placement game, combined with a sudoko like logic puzzle. You combine two cards to make a potion, and try to figure out what the true nature of an ingredent is. The game uses a smartphone app to combine ingredients (by scanning th cards) and to randomize the solution to the puzzle for each game.

item.name: Android: Netrunner
item.comment: An asymmetrical card game, where one players is a mega coorperation that build servers, the other is a hacker/runner trying to hack the coorperation. The coorperation must defend themself quick, but the runner must watch out not to fall into an ambush. A deck building game like Magic, but with a very different flow and theme. There are many strategies to pick from, and part of the fun is making your own desc to pit it against other players.

item.name: Coup
item.comment: In Coup, player gets two secret character cards each. Characters have special abilities, that can be used each turn. The goal is to eliminate all other players cards, by assasignation or coup. The twist is that you can predent to have any character, and perform that special ability. Other players can challenge your honesty, if you lied about your card you loose a card, if you spoke the truth they loose a card.

item.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
item.comment: You lead a faction of survivors in a small, weakened colony of survivors in a world where most of humanity is either dead or diseased. A semi co-op psychological survival game. You work together toward one common victory condition, but must also each complete your own personal secret objective. One of you could be a betrayer, that works against the group. You make frequent difficult decisions that often have you deciding between what is best for the colony and what is best for you.

item.name: Dead of Winter: The Long Night
Dominion
item.comment: You are a monarch, that wants a bigger and more pleasant kingdom, you want more, you want a Dominion! Each player starts with an identical, very small deck of cards. In the center of the table is a selection of other cards the players can buy. When you use a card it goes back into your desc, so you have to construct your deck on the fly, striving for the most efficient path to victory points by end game. You select 10 of the many card types to include in any given play, making each game very different.

item.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue
item.comment: You are the brave men and women of fire rescue; people are depending on you. A cooperative game where players attempt to rescue victims from a raging building fire. As the players attempt to rescue the victims, the fire spreads to other parts of the building, causing structural damage and possibly blocking off pathways through the building.

item.name: Hanabi
item.comment: A cooperative card game. The card deck consists of five different colors of cards, numbered 1 to 5 in each color. For each color, the players try to place a row in the correct order from 1 to 5. Sounds easy, right? Well, not quite, as in this game you hold your cards so that they're visible only to other players. To assist other players in playing a card, you must give them hints regarding the numbers or the colors of their cards. Players must act as a team to avoid errors and win before they run out of cards.

item.name: KeyForge: Call of the Archons – Archon Deck
Mansions of Madness: Second Edition – Beyond the Threshold: Expansion
Mansions of Madness: Second Edition – Recurring Nightmares: Figure and Tile Collection
Mansions of Madness: Second Edition – Suppressed Memories: Figure and Tile Collection
One Night Ultimate Werewolf
item.comment: A fast game in which everyone gets a role. One of the Werewolves or one of the dozen different villigers, each with a special ability. The game consists of two phases, a night and a day phase. During the night everyone closes their eyes and a players take turn "waking up" to perform their special ability. During the day the villigers try to figure out what happened during the night, and who the werewolf is. In the end, players vote on who to lynch. The game uses an app that keeps track of time and tells everyone what to do during the night.

item.name: Pandemic
item.comment: Several virulent diseases have broken out all over the world! You are disease fighting specialists whose mission is to treat disease hotspots while researching cures for each of four plagues before they get out of hand. You must work together and plan your strategy to mesh with each of you special strengths. A game of tough choices, strategy and teamwork.

item.name: Puerto Rico
item.comment: In Puerto Rico players assume the roles of colonial governors on the island of Puerto Rico. The aim of the game is to amass victory points by shipping goods to Europe or by constructing buildings. players grow crops which they exchange for points or doubloons. Doubloons can then be used to buy buildings, which allow players to produce more crops or give them other abilities. Buildings and plantations do not work unless they are manned by colonists. Who can create the best and most effecient colony?

item.name: The Quacks of Quedlinburg: The Herb Witches
The Resistance
item.comment: A game of social deductio with no player elimination. you are either Resistance Operatives or Imperial Spies. For three to five rounds, you must depend on each other to carry out missions against the Empire. At the same time, you must try to deduce the other players identities and gain their trust. Each turn you must put together a team, that you trust, to go on a mission. If you are a spy you must blend in and throw off suspession, if you are resistance, you must find the spies before it is too late.

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
RoboRally
item.comment: You are a supercomputer. You are bored. So you make a little contest for you and a couple of your supercomputing buddies. Your task is to program one of the stupid little robots to move out of the factory floor. Each turn the robots run their programs, while pushing eachother, shooting lazers and messing eachother up.

item.name: Roll for the Galaxy
item.comment: A dice game of building space empires. Your dice represent your populace, whom you direct to develop new technologies, settle worlds, and ship goods. The player who best manages his workers and builds the most prosperous empire wins! Players take simultaneous actions and build up their empire by using many custom dice.

item.name: Sheriff of Nottingham
item.comment: Players take turn being the Sheriff. Other players, acting as Merchants, will attempt to bring their goods into the city for profit. Beware though, while many may act as honest merchants, there is always the possibility of contraband being smuggled into the city! Merchants can try to bribe the sheriff, to not inspect their goods, but if he finds contraband they have to pay a fine. If they were honest merchantsthe sheriff has to pay for the inconvenience. Also known as "Customs" or "What's in the bag you bastard!"

item.name: Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: The Thames Murders & Other Cases
item.comment: A detective game where you try to solve a mystery together. The game consists of 10 cases, a map of london, and a dictionary. You take turns choosing which lead to follow. To follow a lead, you read the matching paragraph in the casebook which gives you clues to the solution. When you feel you have solved the case you compare your solution with the Sherlock Holmes solution. A choose your own detective story.

item.name: Splendor
item.comment: Players take the role of wealthy Renaissance merchants buying and selling gems to turn into beautiful refined jewels. Splendor is an abstract game of "card drafting" and "engine building". On your turn you can only perform one of four different actions, each action is a dilemma. Do you buy the mine that you need now, or do you buy the shop that you know your oponent needs, just so he can't get it. Easy to learn, hard to master.

item.name: T.I.M.E Stories
item.comment: As temporal agents, you will be sent into different worlds, times or realities to successfully complete the missions given to you. Consists of scenarios, which define the rules and theme of the game. You explore the world consisting of beautiful cards together, you can solve puzzles, fight monsters and make tough decisions. Its a race against time, and if you run out, you will be able to go back in time as many times as required. Also known as "Groundhogs Day: The game".

item.name: Tales of the Arabian Nights
item.comment: You are the hero(ine) in a story of adventure and wonder! You will travel the land seeking your own destiny and fortune. Each turn the player has an encounter, and chooses what action to take, the outcome is read from the Book of Tales, that contains 3000+ stories. Choose your actions carefully and the skills you possess will reward you: become beloved, wealthy, mighty. Choose poorly, and become a beggar or a cursed beast! There is a winner, but the point of the game is more to enjoy the unfolding great story.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Europe
item.comment: With elegantly simple gameplay, Ticket to Ride can be learned in under 15 minutes, while providing players with intense strategic and tactical decisions every turn. Players collect cards of various types of train cars they then use to claim railway routes. The longer the routes, the more points they earn. Additional points come to those who fulfill Destination Tickets – goal cards that connect distant cities; and to the player who builds the longest continuous route.
